title: Lenovo Legion Go Review: Can Linux Tame This Unsightly Behemoth?
content:
The Lenovo Legion Go, touted by some as the Switch's big brother and the next "Steam Deck killer," faces hurdles in its Windows-based software and lackluster battery life. Lenovo's unrefined front-end, coupled with the innate limitations of Windows, don't make for a very console-like experience.

Many of these issues, however, can be solved by Linux. Particularly Bazzite, a SteamOS-based distro, offers both a console-like interface and increased fine-tuning over power consumption. This makes for a much better overall experience.
